description:
A day long track to discuss libp2p developments from the ecosystem, libp2p + privacy, new work on the DHT from ProbeLab, and more!

For more information on the day's schedule and other info, please see: https://github.com/libp2p/specs/discussions/591

sessions.name: libp2p Project Update
sessions.description:
Spearker: Juan Benet/Raul Kripalani
Juan and Raul will give an update about the current state of the libp2p project and the future of the libp2p ecosystem

sessions.name: rust-libp2p + Wasm
sessions.description:
Speaker: Doug Anderson
Doug will give a talk on his vision for the future of the internet, which will be built upon libp2p (and now Wasm!)

sessions.name: TBD
sessions.description:
Speaker: Wondertan
@wondertan of Celestia will give a talk on Celestia uses libp2p and more!

sessions.name: libp2p in .NET
sessions.description:
Speaker: Alexey
Alexey from the Nethermind team will give a talk about the brand new .NET libp2p implementation and their journey in creating a new libp2p stack from scratch! This includes key features and perspectives of the new libp2p implementation and an introduction for contributors and architecture overview.

sessions.name: Javascript libp2p v1.0!
sessions.description:
Speaker: Cayman Nava
Js-libp2p is fast approaching its v1.0 release (which may be released on libp2p day or shortly thereafter).
Cayman, maintainer of js-libp2p from ChainSafe Systems, will share the big struggles and wins behind the past 2 years of js-libp2p development. He'll also giving a glimpse of the priorities for the next 6 months.

sessions.name: GossipLog: Durability & Eventual DeliveryforPubSub
sessions.description:
Speaker: Joel
Joel is an ex-PL researcher and co-founder of Canvas, a framework for building automatically decentralized applications.

Decentralized pubsub protocols are optimized for low-latency real-time delivery, but don't have a robust way for peers to catch up on missing messages after long periods of downtime or network partitions. We can use a new type of merkleized database index called Prolly trees to let peers efficiently sync large sets of messages in persistent storage. We can even extend this approach to add causal ordering using logical clocks.

sessions.name: Waku : Uncompromising web3 communication at scale
sessions.description:
Speaker: Guru
Guru is an ex-PL and is currently the DevRel for Waku

In this talk, we will delve into Waku and explore its role in enabling decentralised communications at scale, with a focus on its synergy with the libp2p network stack. Waku is used by @xmtp, RAILGUN and TheGraph for enabling various use cases.

sessions.name: State of js-libp2p in the browser and mobile
sessions.description:
Speaker: Chad
Chad is a maintainer of js-libp2p.
He will explore the stability and performance of libp2p in the browser and update on js-libp2p on mobile.

sessions.name: Un-conference Sessions
sessions.description:
Propose your own talks!
The organizers hope the libp2p community feels empowered to share anything ranging from recent wins, updates, current challenges, deep dives, demos, etc. This can range from a quick lightning talk, show-and-tell demo, to a more thorough deep dive. Anything is welcome - there is no prescribed formula here!
